title: Test
text:
Just a test to see if I can have multiple selections other than the “home” and the “about” selection. Nothing to see here… probably.
Strider 1, Fox 2.

title: Untitled STG
text:
It was supposed to be a proof of concept due to me being inexperienced in coding back in university when I was finishing up my final years. Never thought I’d randomly buy Shooting Game Builder and put the concept in a demo. It sorta worked, but I never got it off its testing phase.
Engine: Shooting Game Builder
Barely made past through the planning stage due to schedule conflicts and me pursuing other passions. I might get back to this later or something, but don’t count on it. TL;DR: it was basically “what if Infinite Stratos (yes, that mediocre anime) were planes instead.” It probably would’ve been similar to Ace Combat or something due to the fact that Ace Combat 3 literally takes place in the future lmao.
Concept Renders drawn by yours truly (yes, they are kind of awful.):



Crimson Lotus - the default 1P ship. Pretty generic. I think I crossed an F-22A Raptor over with Azuma from Raiden V. It ended up looking more like an F-14A Tomcat with a single tail wing haha.





Azure Cyanus - The 2P ship. It was made to be a derivative of Crimson Lotus because I don’t know if STG Builder can handle two players at once.





Winged Dragoon - The heavy hitter. Moves slow, but packs a punch. Yes, this kind of design exists in real life. Search up the “de Havilland Sea Vixen” if you think I’m joking.


Sprites:



Big Zako - It was too big to be a common enemy… sort of.





Yes, the resolution of the game was THAT small. How can you tell?





Ditto.


And just for fun, I decided to give the faceless pilots a bit of a personality as well (I think at that time, every nation was redacted because I didn’t know if I should 1. set the story in the real world far into the future, or 2. make a new world akin to Strangereal.):



Fun fact: This guy’s callsign is a reference to Houki Shinonono from Infinite Stratos. Yes, her name is literally “Broom” in Japanese. Look, I don’t know, okay?





I feel like this would be “easy” to model in blender, PSX style. I think the callsign “Brash Head” was kind of the fact that Winged Dragoon was meant to be for gun nuts. (turrets go “BRRRRRRRRRRRRR”.)

title: About
text:
Mathematician, Applied Emphasis. This website is mostly used as a testing ground for all my experiments, so this is getting constantly updated when I have the chance as I learn the basics… than then advanced stuff.
Disclaimer: I am not a professional programmer, consider this website as me following a tutorial and going through a crash course on JavaScript, CSS, etc.
-Glen

title: Music and Organ
text:
Glen’s personal Quarto website.
Site name’s a wordplay with the logo.
